comments:
In a java project create a visual class extending java.awt.Window
Open this new class in the Visual Editor.
Drop a number of awt widgets on to content pane. 

After a while, the following NullPointException appears (it some times happens 
when you click out and back to the editor)...

surfaced because Window is now in the New Visual Class Wizard.

Forget my earlier comment, I got it again.
currentViewer in AbstractTool is (infrequently) null; trying to find out why

To reproduce in the VE:
1) make editor dirty (by moving a component)
2) press CTRL+S to save
3) select a control

You get a NPE every time.

This seems to be a GEF bug. The ToolUtilities.getSelectionWithoutDependants
throws a NullPointerException because the viewer is null. I don't know how this
could get in this state since the VE doesn't reset the viewer.

It's easy to reproduce. Create a visual class extending JFrame. Drop a JButton
into the center of the contentpane. Do a Ctrl-S to save it. Select the canvas
(free from surface) and then select the JFrame again. When the JFrame is
selected,  the NPE is thrown. Here's the stack trace:

Peter, are you guys getting a FocusLost (Tool#handleFocusLost()) event between:
1) SelectEditPartTracker#handleButtonDown
2) the time when NPE is thrown

Okay... I found a simple test case to recreate this problem:
- create a visual class extending JPanel
- in the VE, resize the JPanel to something and do a Ctrl-S to save it.
- Select the canvas area and then re-select the JPanel.
This causes the NPE.

The problem occurs because during the mouse-down selection process, a listener
on the main "this" part (the JPanel) requires a re-introspection. Because this
task takes more than .8sec (I think), an Eclipse UI progress dialog pops up for
a brief second or so and takes the focus away from the selected part. This
causes the DragEditPartsTracker to set it's viewer to null. When this process
continues after the progress UI has gone away, the viewer is not set again into
the DragEditPartsTracker anc causes the NPE further down the process.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 68003 ***
*** Bug 80585 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
